about.title: About DasBuch
about.intro: Hi, my name is <1>Matheqs</1> and I'm an amateur developer. <3>DasBuch</3> is my first fullstack project, created as a personal challenge to test my skills across the various disciplines involved in building a complete application.
about.background: The idea came from my reading habit, which I've cherished since my teenage years. For years I've been writing book reviews on paper, and I decided to create a digital platform to organize these notes. So, DasBuch is not just a portfolio project â€” I actually use it in my daily life, and you might even come across some of my own reviews here.
about.focus: The project has always focused on <1>simplicity</1>, both in aesthetics and in application logic.

about.termsTitle: Privacy Policy and Terms of Use
about.termsIntro: DasBuch is an independent, non-profit, and personal-use application that may be accessed by interested third parties. Below, I outline the basic usage terms of the platform:

terms.data: <1>Data Collection and Use:</1> The only sensitive data collected by the platform is the email address provided during registration. This data is used only for authentication and account recovery. No personal information is sold, shared, or traded with third parties.
terms.security: <1>Security and Responsibility:</1> The application has no word, phrase, or content filters. This means any published text, including comments, titles, or reviews, is entirely the author's responsibility. The use of offensive language, slander, hate speech, or illegal content may be reported and, if necessary, removed.
terms.storage: <1>Data Storage:</1> Data is stored on servers with restricted access and is used solely to keep the application running. There is no integration with ad systems or browsing statistics collection.
terms.consent: <1>Consent:</1> By using DasBuch, the user automatically agrees to these terms. As a personal and experimental application, these terms may change without prior notice, always aiming for transparency and responsible use of the platform.

about.closing: If you have any questions or suggestions about these terms, feel free to get in touch. Thank you for using DasBuch! ðŸ’™
